Detailed Description

This module provides system/board/application information obtained by the bootloader.

Revision
156174

Function Documentation

void cvmx_sysinfo_add_self_to_core_mask ( void   ) 

This function adds the current cpu to sysinfo coremask.

struct cvmx_sysinfo* cvmx_sysinfo_get ( void   )  [read]

This function returns the application information as obtained by the bootloader.

This function returns the system/board information as obtained by the bootloader.

This provides the core mask of the cores running the same application image, as well as the physical memory regions available to the core.

Returns:
Pointer to the boot information structure
int cvmx_sysinfo_minimal_initialize ( uint64_t  phy_mem_desc_addr,
uint16_t  board_type,
uint8_t  board_rev_major,
uint8_t  board_rev_minor,
uint32_t  cpu_clock_hz 
)

This function is used in non-simple executive environments (such as Linux kernel, u-boot, etc.

) to configure the minimal fields that are required to use simple executive files directly.

Locking (if required) must be handled outside of this function

Parameters:
phy_mem_desc_addr Address of the global physical memory descriptor (bootmem descriptor)
board_type Octeon board type enumeration
board_rev_major Board major revision
board_rev_minor Board minor revision
cpu_clock_hz CPU clock freqency in hertz
Returns:
0: Failure 1: success
void cvmx_sysinfo_remove_self_from_core_mask ( void   ) 

This function removes the current cpu to sysinfo coremask.
